meanings.definition: Give new and improved form, structure, or appearance to.
meanings.sent1: The company revamped its website to make it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent2: She revamped her wardrobe by donating old clothes and buying new ones.
meanings.sent3: The chef revamped the traditional recipe by adding a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the garden was revamped into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: The old car was revamped with a fresh coat of paint and new tires.

meanings.sent1: To boost sales, the store revamped its marketing strategy.
meanings.sent2: The school revamped its curriculum to include more interactive learning activities.
meanings.sent3: The magician revamped his act with new tricks and illusions.
meanings.sent4: The town council revamped the park, adding new benches and a playground.
meanings.sent5: The artist revamped her painting by adding vibrant colors and intricate details.
